meanings.definition: To make a mistake or blunder.
meanings.sent1: I was gaffing when I accidentally dropped the plate.
meanings.sent2: She kept gaffing during the math test.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's gaffing on stage made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His gaffing in the game cost his team the victory.
meanings.sent5: The student's gaffing in the science experiment caused a small explosion.

meanings.definition: A large hook for catching fish.
meanings.sent1: The fisherman used a sturdy gaffing to catch the big fish.
meanings.sent2: The old gaffing was rusted but still effective.
meanings.sent3: The shiny gaffing gleamed in the sunlight by the dock.
meanings.sent4: The gaffing's sharp point easily pierced the fish's scales.
meanings.sent5: He carefully stored the gaffing in his fishing tackle box.

meanings.definition: A pole with a hook used for landing large fish.
meanings.sent1: The fisherman skillfully wielded the gaffing to bring in the massive catch.
meanings.sent2: The gaffing's long handle allowed for a good grip.
meanings.sent3: He pretended the gaffing was a magical staff in his imaginary adventure.
meanings.sent4: The gaffing's hook securely held the struggling fish.
meanings.sent5: She proudly displayed the gaffing as a trophy of her fishing trip.

meanings.sent1: He was gaffing his friend by pretending to be sick.
meanings.sent2: The scammer was gaffing innocent people out of their money.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky fox was gaffing the other animals in the forest.
meanings.sent4: She felt guilty after gaffing her way into the exclusive party.
meanings.sent5: The con artist was gaffing unsuspecting victims with his schemes.
